  3. / Mitre Reseal

Leaking aluminium sliders & windows fixed — proper mitre & sill reseal

Stop water at the source — not with a smear of silicone. We specialise in fixing leaks at mitred frame corners and the sill line on aluminium sliding doors and windows. Instead of masking the problem from the inside, we open the joinery, prepare correctly, back-seal the mitres, and re-seal the sill — then we hose-test and supply before/after photos.

When this service is for you

  • Water pooling at slider corners or tracking under the sill
  • Whistling/draughts or damp carpet beside the door/window
  • New joinery that wasn’t sealed correctly (imported/non-compliant systems)
  • Previous “fix” was just silicone inside — and it’s leaking again

Our process (what you pay for)

  1. Remove the slider sash where needed
  2. Strip all loose/failed sealant from the sill and mitre joints
  3. Mechanically clean & sand back to bright aluminium
  4. Solvent clean (two-cloth method) to remove contaminants
  5. Apply a neutral‑cure, aluminium‑safe sealant deep into accessible mitres
  6. Reassemble and apply a continuous external/backing bead along the sill and into the mitred corners — keeping weep/track drainage open
  7. Gentle hose-test to confirm, plus before/after photos for your records

Why homeowners & builders choose us

  • We repair the actual leak path (mitre & sill), not the symptom
  • Correct materials and surface prep for durable adhesion
  • Wellington-wide, fast quotes, tidy workmanship
  • Clear records for owners, builders and insurers

We reseal within the original joinery system. We do not certify or re‑certify products, and compliance stays with the original manufacturer.
Serving: Wellington, Lower Hutt, Upper Hutt, Petone, Porirua, Kāpiti.
